[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Car Shopping System (CSS) defines requirements for vehicle search, comparisons, financing, test drive scheduling, and customer engagement.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: CSS enables users to search, compare, configure, and purchase vehicles online, integrating with dealerships and financial services.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: CSS integrates with dealership inventory systems, financial institutions, and customer review platforms.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: CSS provides a web-based and mobile-friendly UI with advanced filtering and comparison tools.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: CSS supports cloud-hosted services and integrates with vehicle dealership management systems.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: CSS integrates with third-party APIs for payments, financing, and dealership data.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: CSS secures user interactions through TLS encryption and multi-factor authentication.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: CSS optimizes search and session history.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: CSS automates vehicle recommendations, financing calculations, and test drive scheduling.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: CSS supports multiple regions, languages, and currency conversions.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: CSS connects with automotive review platforms, dealer CRM systems, and payment gateways.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: CSS enables vehicle search, configuration, test drive scheduling, financing options, and purchase processing.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: CSS serves car buyers, dealerships, and financial institutions offering vehicle loans.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: CSS relies on real-time dealership inventory updates and external financial service integrations.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: CSS requires dealership participation, financing partners, and regulatory compliance.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: Financing: Loan options for vehicle purchases.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall integrate with dealership databases for real-time inventory updates.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall support API connections to financial institutions for loan processing and pre-approvals.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall allow users to search and compare vehicles by make, model, price, and specifications (REQ-DB-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall provide customer reviews and ratings for vehicles, sortable by criteria (REQ-DB-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall enable users to schedule test drives at participating dealerships (REQ-INTF-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-004: The system shall allow users to configure vehicle features such as color, trim, and additional options.
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-005: The system shall offer financing estimates and support price negotiation with dealerships (REQ-INTF-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide a user-friendly interface with comparison tools.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall return search results with minimal delay and support several hundred concurrent users.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall store vehicle data, user preferences, and financing details.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall comply with automotive sales and financing regulations.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall adhere to financial transaction security standards, including PCI DSS.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall ensure secure transactions, data encryption, and user privacy protection (REQ-DSGN-001).

[SEC] 3. Verification: Security audits, search response validation, and financing accuracy ensure reliability.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User manuals, API integration guides, and financing documentation.
[SEC] 5. References: PCI DSS compliance, TLS encryption standards, and automotive sales regulations.
